snippet: Confronting blood, body parts and shelled buildings, a United Nations team quietly collected evidence on Friday of a mass atrocity in a desolate hamlet.
abstract: United Nations monitors in Syria collect evidence of a mass atrocity in the desolate hamlet of Qubeir, more than 24 hours after Syrian forces and government supporters blocked their first attempt to visit the site; monitors find blood, body parts and bullet holes but no bodies, reinforcing suspicion that the government had delayed their mission in order to buy time for a cover-up.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell from London; Neil MacFarquhar from Antakya, Turkey; Artin Afkhami from New York; and Helene Cooper from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Confronting blood, body parts and shelled buildings, a United Nations team quietly collected evidence on Friday of a mass atrocity in a desolate hamlet.

headline.seo: U.N. Monitors Find ‘Appalling Scene’ at Syrian Massacre Site
headline.main: U.N. Monitors in Syria Find Grisly Traces of Massacre
headline.print_headline: U.N. Monitors Find Grisly Proof of a Syria Massacre

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
